item.name: Prayers
entries: If Prayers become separated from {@item Thoughts|BrewskiThoughtsPrayers}, either by moving into a different plane or via 300 ft. of distance, any creature in possession of Prayers must make a Constitution saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 2d10} radiant damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.
While you are attuned to Prayers and wearing it on your hand, you receive the following benefits:

items: Whenever you succeed on a melee attack against a creature using Prayers, you regain {@damage 1d4} HP.
Whenever you succeed on a melee attack using Prayers, it deals an additional {@damage 1d4} radiant damage.

entries: Once per long rest, while attuned, Prayers allows you to supercharge an attack by casting {@spell Blinding Smite} as a bonus action (save {@dc 18}).

entries.name: When Used Together
entries: While wearing and attuned to both weapons, the dice used when calculating psychic/radiant damage as a result of a melee attack becomes {@damage 1d6}. Make sure you declare which weapon you are attacking with before making your attack roll.

entries.name: Special
entries: If your class has special rules for handling unarmed strikes (such as the {@class Monk} class), you are not considered armed while wearing these weapons. Each weapon gives you +1 to unarmed strike damage roles.

If you class does not have special rules for handling unarmed strikes, each weapon functions as a simple, light weapon for you, dealing bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your strength modifier.

Thoughts & Prayers are a pair of twin knuckledusters. Each is molded from the same type of metal but, whereas Thoughts is almost fully black in color, Prayers is almost white. Each can be used independently of the other, however they are more powerful when used together by a single creature.
